revised_title: Thermodynamics of Elasticity in Biological Tissues: A Discussion on Meyer's Paper
tldr: This article discusses the thermodynamics of elasticity in biological tissues, specifically focusing on muscle response to adenosine triphosphate (ATP) and the role of cohesive forces within myosin molecules. The authors propose that the folding of polypeptide chains in muscles can be seen as a stage in the formation of globular proteins, and that thermokinetic forces and rubber-like elasticity contribute to muscle tension and elasticity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
